snippet: The president is freeing 40 prisoners serving life sentences as he demonstrates his desire to re-orient the nation’s criminal justice system.
abstract: Pres Obama commutes 95 federal prisoners' sentences and grants two pardons; it is largest number of commutations Obama has made, and double number he has granted since assuming office; commutations and pardons come at time when Obama is pushing for criminal justice system overhaul.

byline.original: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and PETER BAKER
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear and Gardiner Harris contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The president is freeing 40 prisoners serving life sentences as he demonstrates his desire to re-orient the nation’s criminal justice system.

headline.main: In ‘Fairness,’ Obama Commutes Sentences for 95, Mostly Drug Offenders
headline.print_headline: In ‘Fairness,’ Obama Commutes Sentences for 95, Mostly Drug Offenders
